Class DocumentScanView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, AnylineModule<DocumentResultListener>

    public class DocumentScanView
extends AnylineBaseModuleView<DocumentResultListener>

    Anyline Document-Module

    The Anyline Document-Module detects documents and takes a photo for further processing.

      Note the document ratios are implemented for convenience.

    • Method Detail

      • setConfig

        public void setConfig(AnylineViewConfig config)
        Description copied from class: AnylineBaseView

        Set the config to this view.
        Changes to the preview size only have an effect before the camera initialisation. If the cutout is changed after that, you have to call AnylineBaseView.updateCutoutView() for the changes to have an effect.

        This overrides/deletes values that may have been set in xml.

        Overrides:
        setConfig in class AnylineBaseModuleView<DocumentResultListener>
        Parameters:
        config - the config to use

      • setDocumentRatios

        public void setDocumentRatios(java.lang.Double... ratios)
        Sets custom document ratios that should be supported (or null to set back to all supported types).
        Parameters:
        ratios - all supported formats

      • setMaxDocumentRatioDeviation

        public void setMaxDocumentRatioDeviation(java.lang.Double deviation)
        Set the maximum ratio deviation of the document.
        Parameters:
        deviation - the new maximum deviation.

        public void setMaxDocumentOutputResolution(java.lang.Double width,
                                           java.lang.Double height)
        Set the maximum output resolution of the document.
        Parameters:
        width - the new maximum width.
        height - the new maximum height.

      • initAnyline

        public void initAnyline(java.lang.String licenseKey,
                        DocumentResultListener resultListener)
        Description copied from class: AnylineBaseModuleView
        Init the anyline controller with the module specific listener. Implementers must set isCancelOnResult and isDebug to the controller in here, because they may have been set before the init.
        Specified by:
        initAnyline in interface AnylineModule<DocumentResultListener>
        Specified by:
        initAnyline in class AnylineBaseModuleView<DocumentResultListener>
        Parameters:
        licenseKey - the license
        resultListener - the result listener

      • setMinBrightness

        public void setMinBrightness(float minBrightness)
        Set the minimum brightness (default is 60). If the brightness is below this value, the
        Parameters:
        minBrightness - the new minimum brightness.

      • getCurrentFullImage

        public AnylineImage getCurrentFullImage()
        ALPHA method (may be removed in the future). Get the current full image. Can be used in DocumentResultListener#onPictureProcessingFailure(DocumentError) to get the image anyway. (e.g. to save it for debugging)

        Note: Returns a copy of the current full frame image. Once the image is not used anymore the AnylineImage.release() method needs to be called for proper memory management.

        Returns:
        the current full image (may be null)

        Description copied from interface: AnylineModule

        Specified by:

        public void cancelScanning()
        Description copied from interface: AnylineModule

        Specified by:
        cancelScanning in interface AnylineModule<DocumentResultListener>
        Overrides:
        cancelScanning in class AnylineBaseModuleView<DocumentResultListener>

      • setCancelOnResult

        public void setCancelOnResult(boolean isCancelOnResult)
        Description copied from interface: AnylineModule

        If set to true (default) the scanning is canceled automatically when a result is found. (User needs to call startScanning() again to continue scanning.) If set to false the scanning goes on forever until cancelScanning is called manually.

        This MUST be called after AnylineModule.initAnyline(String, AnylineModuleResultListener), or it will have no effect.

        Specified by:
        setCancelOnResult in interface AnylineModule<DocumentResultListener>
        Overrides:
        setCancelOnResult in class AnylineBaseModuleView<DocumentResultListener>

      • transformPicture

        public void transformPicture(AnylineImage fullImage,
                             java.util.List<android.graphics.PointF> corners)
        Transforms an image of a document to a frontal view. This method can be used, when the user manually selects the four corners of the document and only the transformation needs to be done. The transformed image will be returned in DocumentResultListener.onPictureTransformed(AnylineImage). When an error during the transformation occurs, a callback will be triggered in DocumentResultListener#onPictureTransformError(DocumentError).
        Parameters:
        fullImage - The image of the document, that will be transformed.
        corners - The corners based on which the image will be transformed. The order needs to be: upLeft, upRight, downRight, downLeft
        Since:
        3.17.0

      • triggerPictureCornerDetection

        public void triggerPictureCornerDetection()
        Triggers corner detection on the high resolution picture taken by the camera. The taken image along with the (possible) detected corners are returned by DocumentResultListener.onPictureCornersDetected(AnylineImage, List).
        Since:
        3.17.0

      • setPostProcessingEnabled

        public void setPostProcessingEnabled(boolean enabled)
        If enabled, starts post processing after a full document snap. (Default: false)
        Parameters:
        enabled - post processing enabled

      • getPostProcessingEnabled

        public boolean getPostProcessingEnabled()
        Returns true if post processing is enabled.
        Returns:
        post processing enabled
